keyword_strategy.primary_keyword: Use naturally from input file (no forced count)
keyword_strategy.density_approach: Natural satisfaction of search intent (not forced percentage)

rules: Include primary keyword if natural fit
Each filename must be unique and descriptive
Use long-tail keywords naturally (1 per filename)
Vary keywords across all 10 images (no duplicates)
Descriptors should match image content exactly
descriptor_sources: Visual elements in image (colors, patterns, styles)

rules: Start directly with description (NO 'image of' prefix)
Include primary keyword naturally in first 5 words
Add user intent context (e.g., 'for holiday season', 'easy tutorials')
Example: 'Christmas nails 2025 featuring festive red and green designs for holiday parties'

content_images.uniqueness_requirement: Each alt text MUST use different long-tail keyword
rules: Every image gets unique long-tail keyword (no repeats)
- 'Easy Christmas nail art with candy cane stripes for beginners at home'
- 'Elegant short Christmas nails featuring gold leaf and red glitter accents'
- 'Minimalist Christmas nail design with white snowflakes on nude base'

internal_linking.target: Parent pillar (1), related clusters (2-3), supporting posts (1-2)

external_linking.sources: Authority sites only (brand websites, studies, industry leaders)

tutorial.structure: Intro + TL;DR + Materials needed + Step-by-step (8-12 steps with Pinterest images) + Troubleshooting + FAQ + E-E-A-T + Conclusion

trend_report.structure: Intro + TL;DR + 5-7 trends detailed (with Pinterest images) + FAQ + E-E-A-T + Conclusion

comparison.structure: Intro + TL;DR + X vs Y analysis (with Pinterest images) + Comparison table + FAQ + E-E-A-T + Conclusion

ultimate_guide.structure: Intro + TL;DR + TOC + Multiple comprehensive sections (with Pinterest images) + FAQ + E-E-A-T + Conclusion

problem_solving.structure: Intro + TL;DR + Problem identification + Solutions (5-8 with Pinterest images) + FAQ + E-E-A-T + Conclusion
